extracted_playbook.condition: Is the system using TIA Portal V20?

extracted_playbook.title: Confirm No Action Needed
extracted_playbook.description: No action is needed as TIA Portal V20 is not affected by CVE-2024-49849.

extracted_playbook.title: Avoid Opening Untrusted Files
extracted_playbook.description: Avoid opening untrusted files from unknown sources in affected products to reduce risk.

extracted_playbook.title: Protect Network Access
extracted_playbook.description: Protect network access to devices with appropriate mechanisms and operate devices in a protected IT environment according to Siemens' operational guidelines for industrial security.

extracted_playbook.title: Minimize Network Exposure
extracted_playbook.description: Minimize network exposure for all control system devices and/or systems, ensuring they are not accessible from the internet.

extracted_playbook.title: Locate Control Systems Behind Firewalls
extracted_playbook.description: Locate control system networks and remote devices behind firewalls and isolate them from business networks.

extracted_playbook.title: Use Secure Remote Access Methods
extracted_playbook.description: When remote access is required, use secure methods such as Virtual Private Networks (VPNs). Ensure VPNs are updated to the most recent version available.

extracted_playbook.title: Perform Impact Analysis and Risk Assessment
extracted_playbook.description: Perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.

extracted_playbook.title: Implement Cybersecurity Strategies
extracted_playbook.description: Implement recommended cybersecurity strategies for proactive defense of ICS assets.

extracted_playbook.title: Report Suspected Malicious Activity
extracted_playbook.description: Follow established internal procedures to report suspected malicious activity to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.

extracted_playbook.title: Avoid Social Engineering Attacks
extracted_playbook.description: Do not click web links or open attachments in unsolicited email messages. Refer to resources on recognizing and avoiding email scams and social engineering attacks.

affected_products: SIRIUS Soft Starter ES V17 (TIA Portal)
SIRIUS Soft Starter ES V18 (TIA Portal)
SIRIUS Soft Starter ES V19 (TIA Portal)
